intro: Ditassa odorata, commonly known as the sweet-scented wood or fragrant wood, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its aromatic leaves and small, white to pinkish flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are simple, opposite, and often have a pleasant, sweet fragrance when crushed. The flowers are clustered in inflorescences and are pollinated primarily by insects.
